channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8318809] java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentLinkedQueue/WhiteBox.java shows intermittent failures on linux ppc64le and aarch64
item.description:
java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentLinkedQueue/WhiteBox.java shows seldom failures like this (example is from Linux ppc64le) :

test WhiteBox.addActionsOneNodeSlack(WhiteBox$$Lambda/0x00000000422962d0@67990638): success
test WhiteBox.addActionsOneNodeSlack(WhiteBox$$Lambda/0x0000000042296508@184886c2): failure
java.lang.AssertionError: expected [null] but found [java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue$Node@3a49d028]
at org.testng.Assert.fail(Assert.java:99)
at org.testng.Assert.failNotSame(Assert.java:1033)
at org.testng.Assert.assertNull(Assert.java:965)
at org.testng.Assert.assertNull(Assert.java:953)
at WhiteBox.addActionsOneNodeSlack(WhiteBox.java:305)
at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DirectMethodHandleAccessor.invoke(DirectMethodHandleAccessor.java:103)
at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:580)
at org.testng.internal.MethodInvocationHelper.invokeMethod(MethodInvocationHelper.java:132)
at org.testng.internal.TestInvoker.invokeMethod(TestInvoker.java:599)
at org.testng.internal.TestInvoker.invokeTestMethod(TestInvoker.java:174)
at org.testng.internal.MethodRunner.runInSequence(MethodRunner.java:46)
at org.testng.internal.TestInvoker$MethodInvocationAgent.invoke(TestInvoker.java:822)
at org.testng.internal.TestInvoker.invokeTestMethods(TestInvoker.java:147)
at org.testng.internal.TestMethodWorker.invokeTestMethods(TestMethodWorker.java:146)
at org.testng.internal.TestMethodWorker.run(TestMethodWorker.java:128)
at java.base/java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1597)
at org.testng.TestRunner.privateRun(TestRunner.java:764)
at org.testng.TestRunner.run(TestRunner.java:585)
at org.testng.SuiteRunner.runTest(SuiteRunner.java:384)
at org.testng.SuiteRunner.runSequentially(SuiteRunner.java:378)
at org.testng.SuiteRunner.privateRun(SuiteRunner.java:337)
at org.testng.SuiteRunner.run(SuiteRunner.java:286)
at org.testng.SuiteRunnerWorker.runSuite(SuiteRunnerWorker.java:53)
at org.testng.SuiteRunnerWorker.run(SuiteRunnerWorker.java:96)
at org.testng.TestNG.runSuitesSequentially(TestNG.java:1218)
at org.testng.TestNG.runSuitesLocally(TestNG.java:1140)
at org.testng.TestNG.runSuites(TestNG.java:1069)
at org.testng.TestNG.run(TestNG.java:1037)
at com.sun.javatest.regtest.agent.TestNGRunner.main(TestNGRunner.java:102)
at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DirectMethodHandleAccessor.invoke(DirectMethodHandleAccessor.java:103)
at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:580)
at com.sun.javatest.regtest.agent.MainActionHelper$AgentVMRunnable.run(MainActionHelper.java:333)
at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1570)

The failure occurs not very often, only every few months.
It might be related to usage of weakCompareAndSet in the ConcurrentLinkedQueue ; the spec allows sporadic failures and this occurs on Linux ppc64le sometimes.
item.summary: java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentLinkedQueue/WhiteBox.java shows intermittent failures on linux ppc64le and aarch64

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
[jdk11u-fix-request] Approval Request from Amos
"Backporting for parity with 11.0.24-oracle. Clean backport. No risk, test fix. SAP nightlies passed on 2024-04-28.”

[jdk17u-fix-request] Approval Request from Amos
"Backporting for parity with 17.0.12-oracle. Clean backport. No risk, test fix. SAP nightlies passed on 2024-04-28.”

Clean backport to stabilize tests and better parity. Removes test cases, guaranteed to be safe.

Changeset: 50d1839d
Author: Viktor Klang <vklang@openjdk.org>
Committer: Jaikiran Pai <jpai@openjdk.org>
Date: 2023-12-05 05:29:29 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/50d1839d54f13631946925d8ecf03ce71f31bab8

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/16786
Date: 2023-11-22 20:48:05 +0000

[~dl] Given that CLQ hasn't really been updated in a long while, and presuming that this problem hasn't manifested before, my thinking is that there could be a problem with how weakCAS is implemented in ppc64le and Aarch64 OR that the use of weakCAS in CLQ has been incorrect and has just recently started to manifest if/as weak CAS has been implemented for ppc64le & Aarch64 (instead of falling back to using strong CAS).

Thoughts?
[~dl] This is the one we talked about.
